lead_paragraph: FARNWORTH--Maria. On May 8th the singing world lost Maria Farnworth, nee Caruso, the inspiration to generations of voice students. Known internationally for her nuanced approach to teaching her career spanned six decades; her passion compelled her students to higher standards. Born in Brooklyn to Joseph and Teresa Caruso, she studied music and at 19, won a scholarship to the Julliard School. Trained in the Lamperti method, Maria's own discoveries led her to develop her own theory which taught her students to understand the voice as a powerful yet delicate instrument that engaged mind, body and spirit. Beloved for her sharp wit and biting humor, Maria was a source of strength to all. She is survived by her brother Robert Caruso and was mother to three sons: Steven (predeceased), Thomas and Bruce. 1/3
